intro: Aphanamixis apoensis, commonly known as the Apo mountain tree, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in the humid, mountainous regions of the Apo mountain range. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
